name: Movie Epics and Spectaculars Quiz | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who played Tevye in the movie version of 'Fiddler on the Roof'?
questions.explanation:
Topol.

	Zero did it on Broadway; so did Bernardi. Kiley was Don Quixote in 'Man of La Mancha'.

questions.text: 'Ben-Hur' is on everybody's list of super-movies. Charlton Heston played the lead; who played his enemy, Messala?
questions.explanation:
Stephen Boyd.

	Burton and Mature were in other Roman epics.

questions.text: 'Dr Zhivago' is often listed as a masterpiece. Who wrote the novel?
'2001, A Space Odyssey' was unlike any other science fiction movie. Keir Dullea took 'the ultimate trip' who was his fellow astronaut?
questions.explanation:
Gary Lockwood.

	They call it a masterpiece.

questions.text: 'Around The World In Eighty Days' was the blockbuster of its day. Who was the driving force behind the movie?
questions.explanation:
Mike Todd.

	Not long before the plane crash.

questions.text: 'How The West Was Won' was a sprawling western. Which of the following was one of the directors?
questions.explanation:
John Ford.

	The most famous director of westerns?

questions.text: 'The Ten Commandments' was an early spectacular with Heston in the lead. Who played Nefretiri?
questions.explanation:
Anne Baxter.

	Parting the Red Sea.

questions.text: Heston also starred in 'The Greatest Show on Earth'. Who co-starred as Buttons, the clown?
questions.explanation:
James Stewart.

	Wilde and Bettger were in the movie.

questions.text: Peter O'Toole has been in a fair share of classic films. Which of the following is NOT one of his?
questions.explanation:
El Cid.

	Heston played El Cid.

questions.text: 'Judgment at Nuremberg' tackled an interesting topic - human responsibility - at an interesting time - shortly after WW II. Who was the director?
